title: AES Export Filing Certification Interface
description: Enables users to electronically submit, modify, and cancel export shipment data to the U.S. CBP Automated Export System (AES) according to AESTIR specifications, covering various scenarios required for operational certification.
user_roles: Vessel carriers/NVOCCs acting as forwarding agents
functionality: Create and transmit complete export shipment filings.
Modify previously accepted shipments (e.g., change port, add/delete commodity lines).
Handle shipments with multiple commodity lines, including varying units of measure.
Support different transport modes (Air, Truck, Vessel).
Validate data locally and handle/correct fatal errors from AES.
Process various Export Information Codes (EICs) with conditional data requirements (e.g., 'OS', 'HH', 'IS').
Include required data for licensed shipments (BIS, DDTC/USML).
Report specific commodity details (e.g., Used Vehicle VINs).
benefits: Achieve AES operational certification for electronic export filing.
Ensure compliance with CBP AESTIR requirements.
Reduce filing errors through validation and correction capabilities.
